screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T16:23:45.227Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) ðŸ¥µ
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

CVE-2024-20438
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-08T13:54:46.450000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the REST API endpoints of Cisco NDFC could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to read or write files on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because of missing authorization controls on some REST API endpoints. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted API requests to an affected endpoint. A successful exploit could allow th

updated 2024-10-08T13:50:57.163000

2 posts

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to have valid Administrator credentials on the affected device. &nbsp; This vulnerability is due to improper valida

    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) ðŸ¥µ
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

CVE-2024-20441
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-08T13:45:07.300000

2 posts

A vulnerability in a specific REST API endpoint of Cisco NDFC could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to learn sensitive information on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient authorization controls on the affected REST API endpoint. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted API requests to the&nbsp;affected endpoint. A successfu

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) ðŸ¥µ
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #meraki #cve

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability

CVE-2024-9570
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-07T18:31:20

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in D-Link DIR-619L B1 2.06 and classified as critical. Affected by this issue is the function formEasySetTimezone of the file /goform/formEasySetTimezone. The manipulation of the argument curTime leads to buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-07T15:31:50

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in D-Link DIR-619L B1 2.06. Affected is the function formAdvNetwork of the file /goform/formAdvNetwork. The manipulation of the argument curTime leads to buffer overflow. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2021-4043

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T14:53:09.768Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! Page is now live and published on their website.

  • CVE-2019-0344 (9.8 critical) SAP Commerce Cloud Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-4043 (5.5 medium) Motion Spell GPAC Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-15415 (9.8 critical) DrayTek Multiple Vigor Routers OS Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-25280 (9.8 critical) D-Link DIR-820 Router OS Command Injection Vulnerability

The manipulation of the argument curTime leads to buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-04T00:02:55.790Z ##

@lyceris I paraphrased both for brevity and convenience but they're bad audio security risks:

CVE-2024-44207 in Media Session: Audio messages in Messages may be able to capture a few seconds of audio before the microphone indicator is activated

CVE-2024-44204 A logic issue in Passwords: A user's saved passwords may be read aloud by VoiceOver

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-03T23:29:55.365Z ##

Apple security advisories: About the security content of iOS 18.0.1 and iPadOS 18.0.1
2 security fixes: CVE-2024-44207 Audio messages captures audio before microphone indicator is activated, and CVE-2024-44204 VoiceOver might read a user's saved passwords OUT LOUD, WHAT THE FUCK

macOS Sequoia 15.0.1, watchOS 11.0.1, visionOS 2.0.1, Safari 18.0.1 were also updated but have no published CVEs.

#apple #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2017-10271
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.16%

updated 2024-10-04T18:31:09

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: WLS Security). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.1.0 and 12.2.1.2.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##

CVE-2024-44207
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-04T17:31:41.970000

7 posts

This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.0.1 and iPadOS 18.0.1. Audio messages in Messages may be able to capture a few seconds of audio before the microphone indicator is activated.

1 repos

#search_error

AAKL at 2024-10-08T16:39:39.904Z ##

The advisory includes CVE-2024-44204 and CVE-2024-44207.

Cyble: #Apple Issues Urgent Security Advisory for #iOS and iPadOS Vulnerabilities https://cyble.com/blog/apple-issues-urgent-security-advisory-for-ios-and-ipados-vulnerabilities/ @aucyble #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-04T00:02:55.790Z ##

@lyceris I paraphrased both for brevity and convenience but they're bad audio security risks:

CVE-2024-44207 in Media Session: Audio messages in Messages may be able to capture a few seconds of audio before the microphone indicator is activated

CVE-2024-44204 A logic issue in Passwords: A user's saved passwords may be read aloud by VoiceOver

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-03T23:29:55.365Z ##

Apple security advisories: About the security content of iOS 18.0.1 and iPadOS 18.0.1
2 security fixes: CVE-2024-44207 Audio messages captures audio before microphone indicator is activated, and CVE-2024-44204 VoiceOver might read a user's saved passwords OUT LOUD, WHAT THE FUCK

macOS Sequoia 15.0.1, watchOS 11.0.1, visionOS 2.0.1, Safari 18.0.1 were also updated but have no published CVEs.

#apple #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-9514
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T15:31:28

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in D-Link DIR-605L 2.13B01 BETA. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects the function formSetDomainFilter of the file /goform/formSetDomainFilter. The manipulation of the argument curTime leads to buffer overflow. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-9515
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T15:31:28

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in D-Link DIR-605L 2.13B01 BETA. It has been classified as critical. This affects the function formSetQoS of the file /goform/formSetQoS. The manipulation of the argument curTime leads to buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-42017
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T13:51:25.567000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Atos Eviden iCare 2.7.1 through 2.7.11. The application exposes a web interface locally. In the worst-case scenario, if the application is remotely accessible, it allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with system privilege on the endpoint hosting the application, without any authentication.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-10-07T17:02:12.069Z ##

It's time to name and shame as Eviden, a supposed "next-gen technology leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation" decided to sit on a CVSSv3.1 perfect 10.0 critical vulnerability ðŸ¥³ (cc: @cR0w) in Atos Eviden iCare tracked as CVE-2024-42017 for a full year. The CVE was assigned 30 September but this has been known since at least 07 February 2024 (they drafted up a security bulletin on 13 November 2023). The end result? "Given the obsolescence of the product, it was decided not to patch the vulnerabilities..."

In the worst-case scenario, if the application is remotely accessible, it allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with system privilege on the endpoint hosting the application, without any authentication.

I think the worst case scenario is using Eviden products. What exactly is iCare? "This product is an administrative tool to manage the hardware of several servers of the Bullion S and BullSequana S family. Its goal is to ease firmware patching and server sensors monitoring."

#vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-07T17:02:12.000Z ##

It's time to name and shame as Eviden, a supposed "next-gen technology leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation" decided to sit on a CVSSv3.1 perfect 10.0 critical vulnerability ðŸ¥³ (cc: @cR0w) in Atos Eviden iCare tracked as CVE-2024-42017 for a full year. The CVE was assigned 30 September but this has been known since at least 07 February 2024 (they drafted up a security bulletin on 13 November 2023). The end result? "Given the obsolescence of the product, it was decided not to patch the vulnerabilities..."

In the worst-case scenario, if the application is remotely accessible, it allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with system privilege on the endpoint hosting the application, without any authentication.

I think the worst case scenario is using Eviden products. What exactly is iCare? "This product is an administrative tool to manage the hardware of several servers of the Bullion S and BullSequana S family. Its goal is to ease firmware patching and server sensors monitoring."

CVE-2024-47806
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T13:50:43.727000

3 posts

Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.354.v321ce67a_1de8 and earlier does not check the `aud` (Audience) claim of an ID Token, allowing attackers to subvert the authentication flow, potentially gaining administrator access to Jenkins.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-10-04T04:03:41.693Z ##

CVE-2024-47807 and CVE-2024-47806 :: Patch your Jenkins OpenID Connect Authentication Plugin to mitigate Improper Authentication Flaws..

Advisory:
https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-10-02/#SECURITY-3441%20(2)

#Jenkins

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.306Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-9271
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-04T12:31:09

4 posts

The Re:WP plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-10-05T14:35:07.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-9271 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-9271/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_9271

CVE-2024-8802
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-04T06:30:45

4 posts

The Clio Grow plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting due to the use of add_query_arg without appropriate escaping on the URL in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

CVE-2024-47807
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T21:51:03

3 posts

Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.354.v321ce67a_1de8 and earlier does not check the `iss` (Issuer) claim of an ID Token during its authentication flow, a value that identifies the Originating Party (IdP). This vulnerability may allow attackers to subvert the authentication flow, potentially gaining administrator access to Jenkins. OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.355.v3a_fb_fc

patchnow24x7 at 2024-10-04T04:03:41.693Z ##

CVE-2024-47807 and CVE-2024-47806 :: Patch your Jenkins OpenID Connect Authentication Plugin to mitigate Improper Authentication Flaws..

Advisory:
https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-10-02/#SECURITY-3441%20(2)

#PatchNOW
#Jenkins

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.306Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T16:23:45.227Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) ðŸ¥µ
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) ðŸ¥µ
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2024-20498
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-02T21:30:34

2 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in the Cisco AnyConnect VPN server of Cisco Meraki MX and Cisco Meraki Z Series Teleworker Gateway devices could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a DoS condition in the AnyConnect service on an affected device. These vulnerabilities are due to insufficient validation of client-supplied parameters while establishing an SSL VPN session. An attacker could e

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T16:23:45.227Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability

  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-20442
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:39

2 posts

A vulnerability in the REST API endpoints of Cisco Nexus Dashboard could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to perform limited Administrator actions on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient authorization controls on some REST API endpoints. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted API requests to an affected endpoint. A successfu

1 repos

    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2024-20477
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:38

2 posts

A vulnerability in a specific REST API endpoint of Cisco NDFC could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to upload or delete files on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because of missing authorization controls on the affected REST API endpoint. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted API requests to the affected endpoint. A successful exploit

  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) ðŸ¥µ
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:38

2 posts

A vulnerability in the Redfish API of Cisco UCS B-Series, Cisco UCS Managed C-Series, and Cisco UCS X-Series Servers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with administrative privileges to perform command injection attacks on an affected system and elevate privileges to root. This vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker with administrative privileges could explo

(6.5 MEDIUM)

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:38

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to obtain sensitive information from an affected device. This vulnerability is due to a lack of proper data protection mechanisms for certain configuration settings. An attacker with Read-Only Administrator privileges could exploit this vulnerability by brows

##

CVE-2024-0132
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-10-02T14:45:36.160000

10 posts

NVIDIA Container Toolkit 1.16.1 or earlier contains a Time-of-check Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability when used with default configuration where a specifically crafted container image may gain access to the host file system. This does not impact use cases where CDI is used. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, informat

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-10-01T06:25:03.000Z ##

Critical Vulnerability in NVIDIA Container Toolkit Poses Risks to Cloud Environments https://thecyberexpress.com/nvidia-vulnerability-cve-2024-0132/ #NVIDIAContainerToolkit #vulnerabilityinNVIDIA #nvidiavulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20240132

patchnow24x7 at 2024-10-01T04:44:44.084Z ##

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-30T12:30:32.338Z ##

The security issue is tracked as CVE-2024-0132 and allows an adversary to perform container escape attacks and gain full access to the host system, where they could execute commands or exfiltrate sensitive information. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-flaw-in-nvidia-container-toolkit-allows-full-host-takeover/

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-09-29T05:15:23.000Z ##

"A critical bug in Nvidia's widely used Container Toolkit could allow a rogue user or software to escape their containers and ultimately take complete control of the underlying host.

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-0132, earned a 9.0 out of 10 CVSS severity rating, and affects all versions of Container Toolkit up to and including v1.16.1, and Nvidia GPU Operator up to and including 24.6.1."
https://www.theregister.com/2024/09/26/critical_nvidia_bug_container_escape/#:~:text=A%20critical%20bug,and%20including%2024.6.1.

#security

The security issue is tracked as CVE-2024-0132 and allows an adversary to perform container escape attacks and gain full access to the host system, where they could execute commands or exfiltrate sensitive information. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-flaw-in-nvidia-container-toolkit-allows-full-host-takeover/

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-09-29T05:15:23.000Z ##

"A critical bug in Nvidia's widely used Container Toolkit could allow a rogue user or software to escape their containers and ultimately take complete control of the underlying host.

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-0132, earned a 9.0 out of 10 CVSS severity rating, and affects all versions of Container Toolkit up to and including v1.16.1, and Nvidia GPU Operator up to and including 24.6.1."
https://www.theregister.com/2024/09/26/critical_nvidia_bug_container_escape/#:~:text=A%20critical%20bug,and%20including%2024.6.1.

#security

##
dymaxion@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-28T02:14:13.000Z ##

Wow am I glad CVE-2024-0132 isn't my problem. #hugops to the folks whose problem it is

Vendor: Motion Spell
Product: GPAC
Date Added: 2024-09-30

CVE-2020-15415
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.02%

updated 2024-10-01T03:31:35

6 posts

On DrayTek Vigor3900, Vigor2960, and Vigor300B devices before 1.5.1, cgi-bin/mainfunction.cgi/cvmcfgupload allows remote command execution via shell metacharacters in a filename when the text/x-python-script content type is used, a different issue than CVE-2020-14472.

CVE-2024-47076
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

14 posts

CUPS is a standards-based, open-source printing system, and `libcupsfilters` contains the code of the filters of the former `cups-filters` package as library functions to be used for the data format conversion tasks needed in Printer Applications. The `cfGetPrinterAttributes5` function in `libcupsfilters` does not sanitize IPP attributes returned from an IPP server. When these IPP attributes are u

2 repos

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

https://github.com/mutkus/CVE-2024-47076

##
lkarlslund at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.158Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.000Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.000Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

CVE-2024-6769
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

1 posts

A DLL Hijacking caused by drive remapping combined with a poisoning of the activation cache in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated attacker to elevate from a medium integrity process to a high integrity process without the intervention of a UAC prompt.

CVE-2024-45489
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:55.343000

2 posts

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vu

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-09-26T01:00:01.267000

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:28:30.747Z ##

@habr CVE-2024-43491 is technically not an exploited zero-day. The vulnerability was triggered which led to exploitation of other known vulnerabilities instead. CISA removed CVE-2024-43491 from the KEV Catalog based on that clarification.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-02T14:28:30.000Z ##

@habr CVE-2024-43491 is technically not an exploited zero-day. The vulnerability was triggered which led to exploitation of other known vulnerabilities instead. CISA removed CVE-2024-43491 from the KEV Catalog based on that clarification.

(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:32:27

1 posts

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.000Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia

##

CVE-2024-8963
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 30.99%

updated 2024-09-20T16:32:02.563000

4 posts

Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-09T18:40:40.098Z ##

Ivanti Security Advisory: Ivanti CSA (Cloud Services Application) (CVE-2024-9379, CVE-2024-9380, CVE-2024-9381)
Very sneaky of Ivanti to quietly update the security advisory without a changelog: They removed CVE-2024-9381 (CVSSv3: 7.2 high) Path traversal in Ivanti CSA before version 5.0.2 from the exploitation announcement:

We have observed limited exploitation of CSA 4.6 when CVE-2024-9379 or CVE-2024-9380 are chained with CVE-2024-8963, present in CSA 4.6 patch 518 and below, it could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution. We have not observed these vulnerabilities being exploited in CSA 5.0.

See parent toot above for the original wording. cc: @cR0w @reverseics

#ivanti #patchtuesday #zeroday #vulnerability #cve #activeexploitation #ivanticsa #cloudservicesappliance #eitw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-08T14:43:14.177Z ##

Happy EXPLOITED ZERO-DAY #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: October Security Update

We are aware of a limited number of customers running CSA 4.6 patch 518 and prior who have been exploited when CVE-2024-9379, CVE-2024-9380 or CVE-2024-9381 are chained with CVE-2024-8963.

  • CVE-2024-9379 (6.5 medium) SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-9380 (7.2 high) OS command injection
  • CVE-2024-9381 (7.2 high) path traversal cc: @cR0w @reverseics

#ivanti #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #zeroday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-09T18:40:40.000Z ##

Ivanti Security Advisory: Ivanti CSA (Cloud Services Application) (CVE-2024-9379, CVE-2024-9380, CVE-2024-9381)
Very sneaky of Ivanti to quietly update the security advisory without a changelog: They removed CVE-2024-9381 (CVSSv3: 7.2 high) Path traversal in Ivanti CSA before version 5.0.2 from the exploitation announcement:

We have observed limited exploitation of CSA 4.6 when CVE-2024-9379 or CVE-2024-9380 are chained with CVE-2024-8963, present in CSA 4.6 patch 518 and below, it could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution. We have not observed these vulnerabilities being exploited in CSA 5.0.

  • CVE-2024-9379 (6.5 medium) SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-9380 (7.2 high) OS command injection

Ruby-SAML in <= 12.2 and 1.13.0 <= 1.16.0 does not properly verify the signature of the SAML Response. An unauthenticated attacker with access to any signed saml document (by the IdP) can thus forge a SAML Response/Assertion with arbitrary contents. CVE-2024-5910(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-09T05:01:56

2 posts

Missing authentication for a critical function in Palo Alto Networks Expedition can lead to an Expedition admin account takeover for attackers with network access to Expedition. Note: Expedition is a tool aiding in configuration migration, tuning, and enrichment. Configuration secrets, credentials, and other data imported into Expedition is at risk due to this issue.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-09T16:51:28.587Z ##

Horizon3: Palo Alto Expedition: From N-Day to Full Compromise
References:

  • CVE-2024-5910 (CVSSv4: 9.3 critical, disclosed 10 July 2024 by Palo Alto Networks) Expedition: Missing Authentication Leads to Admin Account Takeover
  • CVE-2024-9464 Expedition: Authenticated Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-9465 Expedition: Unauthenticated SQL Injection
  • CVE-2024-9466 Expedition: Cleartext Credentials in Logs

Daaaaaaaamn @hacks_zach, Zach Hanley at it again with the Palo Alto Networks vulnerabilities. In trying to find CVE2-2024-5910 in Expedition (a configuration migration tool from a supported vendor to Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS), he found CVE-2024-9464, CVE-2024-9465 and CVE-2024-9466. It appears that CVE-2024-9465 (unauth SQL injection) leads to leaking credentials via "users" and "devices" tables which contain password hashes and device API keys. This is the CVE-2024-9466.

#paloaltonetworks #expedition #vulnerability #CVE #vulnerabilityanalysis

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-09T16:51:28.000Z ##

Horizon3: Palo Alto Expedition: From N-Day to Full Compromise
References:

  • CVE-2024-5910 (CVSSv4: 9.3 critical, disclosed 10 July 2024 by Palo Alto Networks) Expedition: Missing Authentication Leads to Admin Account Takeover
  • CVE-2024-9464 Expedition: Authenticated Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-9465 Expedition: Unauthenticated SQL Injection
  • CVE-2024-9466 Expedition: Cleartext Credentials in Logs

Daaaaaaaamn @hacks_zach, Zach Hanley at it again with the Palo Alto Networks vulnerabilities. In trying to find CVE2-2024-5910 in Expedition (a configuration migration tool from a supported vendor to Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS), he found CVE-2024-9464, CVE-2024-9465 and CVE-2024-9466. It appears that CVE-2024-9465 (unauth SQL injection) leads to leaking credentials via "users" and "devices" tables which contain password hashes and device API keys. This is the CVE-2024-9466.

CVE-2024-6197
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:14

2 posts

libcurl's ASN1 parser has this utf8asn1str() function used for parsing an ASN.1 UTF-8 string. Itcan detect an invalid field and return error. Unfortunately, when doing so it also invokes `free()` on a 4 byte localstack buffer. Most modern malloc implementations detect this error and immediately abort. Some however accept the input pointer and add that memory to its list of available chunks. This

screaminggoat at 2024-10-08T17:41:57.817Z ##

  • CVE-2024-43572 (7.8 high) Microsoft Management Console Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED, EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-43583 (7.8 high) Winlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-20659 (7.1 high) Windows Hyper-V Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-6197 (8.8 high) Open Source Curl Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs fÃ¼r remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhÃ¶ht massiv die AngriffsoberflÃ¤che und Chrome unter Android bietet keine MÃ¶glichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhÃ¶ht massiv die AngriffsoberflÃ¤che und Chrome unter Android bietet keine MÃ¶glichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:31:55

An issue was discovered on Supermicro BMC firmware in select X11, X12, H12, B12, X13, H13, and B13 motherboards (and CMM6 modules). An unauthenticated user can post crafted data to the interface that triggers a stack buffer overflow, and may lead to arbitrary remote code execution on a BMC.

The Materialis Companion plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's materialis_contact_form shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.41 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.28%

updated 2024-07-18T01:00:03.197000

4 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

breachhq at 2024-10-07T13:37:18.899Z ##

ðŸš¨#DataBreachðŸš¨
On October 4, 2024, it was reported that several well-known brands, including Ray-Ban, National Geographic, Whirlpool, and Segway, experienced breaches of their web stores due to the CosmicSting vulnerability, CVE-2024-34102. This vulnerability, identified in Adobe's Commerce and Magento software, allows cybercriminals to tamper with webpage content, enabling them to siphon off sensitive user data quietly. The flaw, rated...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/adobe-commerce/2024-oct

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:04:53.037Z ##

Sansec: Thousands of Adobe Commerce stores hacked in competing CosmicSting campaigns
Reference: CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 July 2024 by Adobe as an exploited zero-day, added to KEV Catalog 17 July 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability... aka CosmicSting

Sansec reports that 5% of all Adobe Commerce and Magento stores have been hacked since the announcement of the exploited zero-day CVE-2024-34102. Seven distinct groups are using CosmicSting attacks to plant malicious code on victim stores.

Usually, the first hacker to break into a site will secure it to keep others out. However, the CosmicSting vulnerability prevents this, leading to multiple groups fighting for control over the same store and evicting each other again and again.

Sansec lists and describes the cybercriminals:

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script
  • Group Surki: used the number 42 to encrypt its payload and operates using domain fallodick87-78[.]sbs
  • Group Burunduki: their loader uses a custom port sniffer for a websocket at wss[://]jgueurystatic[.]xyz:8101
  • Group Ondatry: builds custom malware that integrates specifically with the payment solution of that merchant.
  • Group Khomyaki: uses malware loader endppoints with two character URIs
  • Group Belki: uses CosmicSting with CNEXT for RCE, hides backdoors in files, and background processes, injects skimming malware

Indicators of compromise are all over the blog post. There are also older indicators

#threatintel #cybercrime #cosmicsting #CVE_2024_34102 #adobecommerce #magento #IOC #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2023-36756
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-05-29T03:15:59.983000

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 â€“ No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr BazydÅ‚o @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##

CVE-2024-1580
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-27T18:32:38

2 posts

An integer overflow in dav1d AV1 decoder that can occur when decoding videos with large frame size. This can lead to memory corruption within the AV1 decoder. We recommend upgrading past version 1.4.0 of dav1d.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-10-04T14:43:49.993Z ##

Google Project Zero: Effective Fuzzing: A Dav1d Case Study
Google Project Zero publishes vulnerability details (and a proof of concept) about CVE-2024-1580 (5.9 medium, disclosed 14 February 2024 by dav1d) integer overflow in dav1d AV1 video decoder. The short explanation is that when multiple decoding threads are used, a signed 32-bit integer overflow can occur when calculating the values to put in the tile start offset array. Dav1d is already being fuzzed by at least oss-fuzz, but it has its limitations: "It's good that the fuzzer will create one or four threads, depending on the fuzzer configuration, but if vulnerabilities exist only when there are three threads, or 19 threads, these will not be detected by any use of this fuzzer."

Another example of untested coverage in the dav1d fuzzer, and the most interesting one for me because it led to the discovery of the integer overflow vulnerability, is the usage of DAV1D_FUZZ_MAX_SIZE.
This maximum frame size did not exist in all configurations used by dav1d users, and although 32-bit platforms have an internally applied limit, there is no limit by default for 64-bit platforms. Removing this line (and using the multithreaded fuzzer with ubsan enabled) was enough to trigger the integer overflow.

#CVE_2024_1580 #vulnerability #CVE #dav1d #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-04T14:43:49.000Z ##

Google Project Zero: Effective Fuzzing: A Dav1d Case Study
Google Project Zero publishes vulnerability details (and a proof of concept) about CVE-2024-1580 (5.9 medium, disclosed 14 February 2024 by dav1d) integer overflow in dav1d AV1 video decoder. The short explanation is that when multiple decoding threads are used, a signed 32-bit integer overflow can occur when calculating the values to put in the tile start offset array. Dav1d is already being fuzzed by at least oss-fuzz, but it has its limitations: "It's good that the fuzzer will create one or four threads, depending on the fuzzer configuration, but if vulnerabilities exist only when there are three threads, or 19 threads, these will not be detected by any use of this fuzzer."

Another example of untested coverage in the dav1d fuzzer, and the most interesting one for me because it led to the discovery of the integer overflow vulnerability, is the usage of DAV1D_FUZZ_MAX_SIZE.
This maximum frame size did not exist in all configurations used by dav1d users, and although 32-bit platforms have an internally applied limit, there is no limit by default for 64-bit platforms. Removing this line (and using the multithreaded fuzzer with ubsan enabled) was enough to trigger the integer overflow.

#CVE_2024_1580 #vulnerability #CVE #dav1d #infosec #cybersecurity

screaminggoat at 2024-10-09T14:18:18.957Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA only adds two of the Ivanti exploited zero-day vulnerabilities, and a Fortinet vulnerability to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-9380 (7.2 high, disclosed 08 October 2024 by Ivanti as exploited zero-day) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) OS Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-9379 (6.5 medium, disclosed 08 October 2024 by Ivanti as exploited zero-day) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) SQL Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-23113 (9.8 critical, disclosed 08 February 2024 by Fortinet) Fortinet Multiple Products Format String Vulnerability

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs fÃ¼r remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhÃ¶ht massiv die AngriffsoberflÃ¤che und Chrome unter Android bietet keine MÃ¶glichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

CVE-2023-36050
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2023-11-14T18:30:36

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 â€“ No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr BazydÅ‚o @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##
PC_Fluesterer@social.tchncs.de at 2024-10-04T13:51:50.000Z ##

@sihaha
My first question is always: How is the initial entry accomplished, where does the attack vector start? Answers here:
- misconfigurations or
- exploit vulnerability in Apache RocketMQ (CVE-2023-33246).

Both are administration faults. The latter because updates were available immediately. Failure to install those is an administrator's fault.

CVE-2022-31197
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2023-11-07T03:47:35.327000

2 posts

PostgreSQL JDBC Driver (PgJDBC for short) allows Java programs to connect to a PostgreSQL database using standard, database independent Java code. The PGJDBC implementation of the `java.sql.ResultRow.refreshRow()` method is not performing escaping of column names so a malicious column name that contains a statement terminator, e.g. `;`, could lead to SQL injection. This could lead to executing add

petrillic@hachyderm.io at 2024-10-09T21:03:53.000Z ##

Few things make me hate the security industry as much as the dumb ass CVSS scores so many CVE receive. Take CVE-2022-31197. It literally requires you to have a column with a â€œ;â€ in the name.

I mean yes, but holy fuck peopleâ€¦ if you do that you have so many other problems to deal with first.

Could it happen? Sure. Will it? I sure hope your database isnâ€™t that absolutely bonkers.

CVE-2021-25735
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2023-06-26T19:16:31.153000

2 posts

A security issue was discovered in kube-apiserver that could allow node updates to bypass a Validating Admission Webhook. Clusters are only affected by this vulnerability if they run a Validating Admission Webhook for Nodes that denies admission based at least partially on the old state of the Node object. Validating Admission Webhook does not observe some previous fields.

1 repos

https://github.com/darryk10/CVE-2021-25735

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-10-04T18:16:06.000Z ##

This article discusses the validating admission webhook bypass vulnerability, which allows node updates to bypass a validating admission webhook

You will learn how to detect this type of event by enabling Kubernetes Audit Logging in the cluster

âžœ https://sysdig.com/blog/cve-2021-25735-kubernetes-admission-bypass

updated 2023-01-27T05:02:32

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Console). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.1.0.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeove

Nuclei template

https://github.com/amacloudobia/CVE-2020-14883

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

updated 2021-12-21T01:29:02.553000

On Draytek Vigor3900, Vigor2960, and Vigor 300B devices before 1.5.1.1, there are some command-injection vulnerabilities in the mainfunction.cgi file.

linux_mclinuxface@fosstodon.org at 2024-10-02T22:20:48.000Z ##

#Valkey 8.0.1 and 7.2.7 are out and fix:

- CVE-2024-31449 Lua library commands may lead to stack overflow and potential RCE.
- CVE-2024-31227 Potential Denial-of-service due to malformed ACL selectors.
- CVE-2024-31228 Potential Denial-of-service due to unbounded pattern matching.

(FYI these are also present in Redis which released their patched versions 3 hour ago)
